recipes.title: Tomato Basil Topping
recipes.description: Fresh tomato and basil topping, perfect for bruschetta or as a bread accompaniment.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine diced tomatoes, basil, and garlic.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, toss gently to combine.
Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve on toasted bread slices or as a topping for grilled meats.

notes: Best made with ripe summer tomatoes.
Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days; bring to room temperature before serving.

recipes.title: BBQ Meatballs
recipes.description: Easy crockpot meatballs in a sweet and tangy BBQ sauce.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients except meatballs.
Add to meatballs in crock pot and heat thoroughly, mixing occasionally.

notes: Perfect for parties and potlucks.
Can use any type of frozen meatballs.

recipes.title: Popeye's Classic Spinach Dip
recipes.description: A creamy spinach dip with water chestnuts and vegetable soup mix.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until well blended.
Cover and chill for several hours before serving.
Serve with raw vegetables, chips, or crackers.

notes: Can use low fat sour cream and mayonnaise.
Makes about 4 cups of dip.

recipes.title: Spring Rolls
recipes.description: Fresh Vietnamese-style spring rolls with chicken, shrimp, and vegetables, served with a ginger dipping sauce.

instructions.text: Prepare sauce by combining all ingredients in pot. Simmer for 4 minutes. Remove and chill.
To fill the spring rolls, soak the rice paper sheets in hot water for 2-3 minutes. Remove and place on damp towel.
Arrange each of the following ingredients and roll like a burrito. Fold ends in first, then roll it tight.

notes: Serve with dipping sauce on the side
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 60.jpeg

recipes.title: Buffalo Wings
recipes.description: Classic spicy buffalo wings baked in the oven and served with vegetable sticks and dip.

instructions.text: Bake wings 1 hour at 400 degrees.
Combine hot sauce with melted butter in a large bowl. Add wings and toss to coat.
Serve with Touchdown Yogurt Dip, below, and vegetable sticks. Serves 4 to 6.

recipes.title: Touchdown Yogurt Dip
recipes.description: A tangy blue cheese yogurt dip perfect for buffalo wings and vegetables.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and refrigerate.

recipes.title: No-Fumble Spinach-Artichoke Dip
recipes.description: A creamy spinach artichoke dip served in a hollowed pumpernickel bread bowl.

ingredients.prep_note: 1 package, thawed and squeezed of excess water

instructions.text: Melt butter with oil in large, heavy pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; saute until onion is tender, about 6 minutes.
Add flour and stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth and bring to a boil, whisking constantly. Cook until mixture thickens, about 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Stir in spinach, artichokes, Parmesan cheese, yogurt and cayenne pepper. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, hollow out a loaf of pumpernickel bread and fill with dip. Accompany with pumpernickel bread chunks.

recipes.title: Quarterback Sneak Pizza Muffins
recipes.description: Individual pizza muffins made with biscuits, ground beef, and pizza toppings.

ingredients.item: ground beef or crumbled Italian sausage

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Separate biscuits; pat into 3-inch circles. Press circles into muffin cups (there should be 4 if using 12-cup pan) halfway with water. Set aside.
In large nonstick skillet over high heat, cook meat, green pepper and mushrooms until meat is browned, about 5 minutes, stirring to separate meat. Drain fat.
Add pizza sauce, cheese and pepper sauce; mix well. Bring to a boil, stirring.
Mound filling into muffin cups, dividing evenly.
Bake 20 minutes until muffins are browned. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 servings.

notes: Use sliced pitted olives, chopped onions, cooked crumbled sausage, chopped bell peppers or sliced mushrooms as toppings

recipes.title: Snappy Chicken Wings
recipes.attribution: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken wings coated in cayenne pepper sauce.

ingredients.item: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread
Wish-Bone Chunky Blue Cheese or Just 2 Good! Blue Cheese Dressing

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°. Cut tips off wings; cut wings in half at joint.
In bowl, combine cayenne pepper sauce, Spread and pepper. Stir in wings until coated.
In roasting pan or bottom of broiler pan lined with aluminum foil, arrange wings.
Bake 1 hour or until wings are thoroughly cooked and crisp.
Serve with Wish-Bone Chunky Blue Cheese or Just 2 Good! Blue Cheese Dressing.

notes: Use more or less cayenne pepper as desired

recipes.title: Treasure Cave Blue Cheese Dressing
recipes.description: A creamy homemade blue cheese dressing perfect for salads or as a vegetable dip.

instructions.text: Mash Treasure Cave Blue Cheese and buttermilk until mixture resembles cottage cheese.
Add remaining ingredients and blend thoroughly. Add salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

notes: Perfect as a salad dressing or vegetable dip

recipes.title: King's Bacon Bowl Dip
recipes.description: A creamy bacon spinach dip served in a hollowed King's Hawaiian bread bowl.

instructions.text: CARVE out center core of bread within one inch of bottom and sides, keeping bread intact.
CUBE removed bread and additional loaf. Place bowl and cubes on baking sheets and bake in pre-heated 350°F oven for 11-13 minutes, until golden brown.
BLEND mayo and sour cream together in a medium bowl. Add bacon and spinach; mix well. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled.
Just before serving, stir in tomatoes; salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to bread bowl and serve with toasted bread cubes.

recipes.title: Artichoke Cheese Dip
recipes.source_note: Recipe card with Easter egg decoration
recipes.description: A creamy, cheesy dip with artichoke hearts and green chiles.

instructions.text: Mix all together.
Put in microwave to warm when ready to serve.

notes: Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 76.jpeg

recipes.title: Spinach Balls
recipes.description: Crispy baked spinach and cheese balls, perfect as an appetizer.

instructions.text: Combine potatoes, spinach and eggs in a medium bowl. Mix with a mixer until well blended.
Season with nutmeg and cayenne pepper. Add cheese and 4 tablespoons of flour, stirring until incorporated.
Spread remaining flour on a glass plate seasoned with salt and pepper.
Form potato mixture into 1-inch balls, roll in flour to coat, and place on a cooking spray-coated baking sheet.
Refrigerate for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 450°F.
Remove balls from refrigerator and lightly spray with cooking spray.
Bake 12 to 14 minutes until golden brown and firm.
Serve with ranch dressing and fresh lemon.

notes: Chilling before baking helps them hold their shape
Beginning of recipe was cut off

flags: Recipe completed from Idaho Potato Commission official recipe

recipes.title: Onion Flower Dip
recipes.description: A creamy, spicy dip perfect for serving with blooming onions or other fried appetizers.

instructions.text: Combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 tablespoon chili powder and 1 1/2 teaspoon Cajun seasoning.
Blend well.

notes: Serve with Blooming Onion or other fried appetizers

recipes.title: Refrito Spread
recipes.description: A homemade bean dip with cumin, chili, and cheddar cheese.

ingredients.item: cooked, well-drained pinto, kidney or black beans
chopped green pepper or chili peppers

instructions.text: Mash the beans. You should end up with about a cup.
Chop the onion and saute with whole garlic cloves in oil.
When the onion is done, crush the garlic with a fork. Add the spices and the green pepper.
Cook until the pepper is softened and the spices are fragrant.
Remove from heat and cool slightly. Add beans and mix.
Add cheese and salt, and check the flavor.

notes: Use green chili peppers for more heat

recipes.title: Crispy Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Oven-baked crispy chicken wings coated in seasoned breadcrumbs - perfect for parties.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken wings; drain. Remove wing tip portion. Separate remaining sections at joint so there are two pieces.
Mix seasoned bread crumbs, flour, salt, and pepper to taste. Coat wing sections in flour mixture.
Lay on cookie sheet with sides (15 x 10 x 1-inch) that has been sprayed with vegetable oil spray. 6 pounds chicken wings fit on 1 cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 50 minutes.
Remove from baking sheet as soon as done so wings don't stand in meat drippings. Can be made ahead and served after refrigeration. Serve with dipping sauces.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated
Serve with your favorite dipping sauces

recipes.title: Spinach Dip in Rye Round
recipes.description: Classic creamy spinach dip served in a hollowed rye bread bowl with bread cubes for dipping.

ingredients.prep_note: thawed and squeezed completely free of water (do not cook)

instructions.text: Mix the spinach, onion, parsley, olives, mayonnaise, sour cream, celery salt, tarragon, sugar, and pepper. Chill for 25 minutes.
Hollow out loaf of bread by pulling bite-size pieces. Fill hollow with spinach dip and refrigerate until serving.
Serve with bread cubes surrounding round loaf.

notes: Can be made a day ahead: Hollow out bread and put dip inside for 24 hours. Store bread cubes in plastic bag in refrigerator until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Philly Cheesy Chili Topper
recipes.description: Quick microwave appetizer with cream cheese, chili, and cheddar - serve with crackers.

instructions.text: Place unwrapped block of cream cheese on microwavable plate; top with chili and cheese.
Microwave on HIGH 45 seconds to 1 minute or until cheddar cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve with assorted Nabisco crackers.

notes: Super quick appetizer for game day or parties

recipes.title: He'll Get Hot Under The Collar (Stuffed Jalapenos)
recipes.description: Baked cream cheese-stuffed jalapeño poppers with three cheeses.

instructions.text: Cut peppers in half lengthwise; remove seeds.
Combine cheeses; spoon evenly into pepper halves.
Place in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.
Serve warm with salsa.

notes: Wear gloves when handling jalapeños
Lighter version using reduced-fat cheeses

recipes.title: Fenneled Olives
recipes.description: Greek olives marinated with fennel, garlic, citrus peel, and honey - refrigerate at least 24 hours.

instructions.text: Puree fennel seeds, garlic, orange juice and vinegar in a blender, or with a mortar and pestle, until a liquid paste is formed. Pureeing will take 2 or 3 minutes in a blender.
With a rubber spatula, scrape the fennel mixture onto olives.
Stir orange peel, lemon peel and honey into the olives.
Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours, stirring or shaking occasionally.

notes: Must marinate at least 24 hours for best flavor
Great appetizer or antipasto

recipes.title: Danish Ham and Cheese Cake
recipes.description: Elegant savory cheesecake appetizer with ham, three cheeses, tomato, and olives - serves 20 as hors d'oeuvres.

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, or sliced French bread
mellow or aged, to melt completely

instructions.text: Butter 1½-quart souffle dish; set aside. Cut cheese approximately ⅜-inch thick.
Fit enough of the slices in bottom of dish to cover completely. Line sides of dish with 2-inch wide slices of cheese, fitting pieces closely together.
Reserve enough sliced cheese to cover top; dice remaining cheese and set aside.
Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft; remove from heat. Cool slightly.
Stir in remaining ingredients except garnish, crackers or bread, and spoon into cheese-lined dish, pressing gently.
Cover top completely with reserved cheese slices.
Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely.

notes: Can be assembled a day ahead and refrigerated; allow extra 5-10 minutes baking time
Both French bread and 'homemade' Blue Cheese Crackers compliment this delicious party-starter
Unlike souffles, this recipe always works

flags.issue: Some ingredient quantities not specified - cheese types and ham amount unclear

recipes.title: Cheese Wafers
recipes.description: Crispy, buttery cheese crackers with a hint of cayenne heat - perfect for entertaining.

instructions.text: Blend butter and grated cheese together.
Add pepper and salt to taste.
Work in flour with mixer or by hand until mixture holds together.
Pat into 1-inch circle (log), wrap in wax paper and foil.
Chill overnight.
Roll out 1/2-inch thick on floured board.
Cut dough into strips or shapes.
Bake on floured pan at 425°F (220°C) until golden brown, about 10 minutes.

notes: Must chill overnight for best results
Sharp cheddar works well

recipes.title: Ultimate 7-Layer Dip
recipes.description: Classic layered Mexican dip with beans, sour cream, salsa, and toppings.

instructions.text: Mix beans and taco seasoning mix together.
Spread bean mixture onto bottom of 9-inch pie plate.
Layer remaining ingredients over bean mixture: sour cream, salsa, lettuce, cheese, green onions, and olives.
Cover and refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
Serve with tortilla chips or assorted crackers.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated
Classic party appetizer

recipes.title: Sausage Cheese Balls
recipes.description: Savory sausage and cheese appetizer balls, perfect for parties.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Shred cheese if not pre-shredded.
Mix all ingredients together until well combined.
Form into 1-inch balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Can be frozen uncooked
For firmer texture, add extra 3 cups biscuit mix and 2 cups shredded cheese

recipes.title: Chili Rellenos
recipes.description: Simple fried jalapeno and cheese cakes.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together until well combined.
Heat oil in skillet over medium heat.
Drop mixture by spoonfuls into hot oil to form little cakes.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

notes: Simple, quick appetizer
Adjust jalapeno amount to taste

recipes.title: Vidalia Onion Dip
recipes.attribution: 1989 Vidalia Onion Cookoff Grand Prize Winner
recipes.description: Award-winning sweet onion dip - grand prize winner at the 1989 Vidalia Onion Cookoff.

instructions.text: Peel and thinly slice the onions.
Soak for 2 to 4 hours in the sugar, vinegar, and water mixture.
Drain well.
Toss with mayonnaise and celery salt.
Serve on saltine crackers. Also great with hot dogs and hamburgers.

notes: Grand Prize Winner - 1989 Vidalia Onion Cookoff, Glennville, GA
The sugar-vinegar soak mellows the onions

recipes.title: Vidalia Cheese Wafer
recipes.description: Sharp cheddar cheese crackers with Vidalia onion and a hint of cayenne.

instructions.text: In large mixing bowl, blend grated Cheddar with flour, Parmesan, seasoned salt, butter (cut in bits), diced sweet onion and cayenne.
Blend well by beating with a wooden spoon or mixer.
Form dough into two rolls; wrap in plastic wrap.
Place in freezer 30 minutes or fridge for a couple of hours.
Slice into wafers about ¼-inch thick.
Space close together, but not touching, on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake one sheet at a time at 375°F (190°C) for about 15 minutes, or just until done.

notes: Can freeze dough logs for later use
Great appetizer crackers

recipes.title: Onion Squares
recipes.description: Savory biscuit-based squares topped with sautéed onions and sour cream.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Blend 1 egg and milk with biscuit mix and poppy seeds.
Turn dough into a greased 9-inch square baking pan.
Sauté onions in butter until tender.
Spread onions on dough.
Beat the other egg with sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
Spread sour cream mixture over onions.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
Cut into squares. Sprinkle with paprika.

notes: From Bland Farms, Glennville, GA - home of Vidalia onions

recipes.title: Hooters Buffalo Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Nearly world famous. Often imitated, hardly ever duplicated. Copycat recipe for Hooters-style buffalo wings.

ingredients.item: Crystal Louisiana Hot Sauce or Frank's Red Hot Cayenne Sauce

instructions.text: Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375°F. You want just enough oil to cover the wings entirely—an inch or so deep at least.
Combine the butter, hot sauce, ground pepper, and garlic powder in a small saucepan over low heat. Heat until the butter is melted and the ingredients are well-blended.
Combine the flour, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt in a small bowl.
If the wings are frozen, be sure to defrost and dry them. Put the wings into a large bowl and sprinkle the flour mixture over them, coating each wing evenly.
Put the wings in the refrigerator for 60 to 90 minutes. (This will help the breading to stick to the wings when fried.)
Put all the wings into the hot oil and fry them for 10 to 15 minutes or until some parts of the wings begin to turn dark brown.
Remove the wings from the oil to a paper towel to drain. But don't let them sit too long, because you want to serve the wings hot.

Quickly put the wings into a large bowl. Add the hot sauce and stir, coating all of the wings evenly. You could also use a large plastic container (such as Tupperware) with a lid for this. Put all the wings inside the container, add the sauce, put on the lid, then shake.
Serve with bleu cheese dressing and celery sticks on the side.

notes: From Top Secret Recipes cookbook
Hooters started in Clearwater, Florida on April Fool's Day 1983
The refrigeration step is key for crispy coating

recipes.title: Bacon Bites
recipes.description: Sweet and savory candied bacon bites cooked in the microwave - addictive party appetizer.

instructions.text: Arrange bacon slices, about 6 at a time, in a single layer on a microwave roasting rack set in a glass baking dish.
Combine brown sugar and mustard.
Sprinkle evenly over bacon.
Cook on high 1 minute per bacon slice.
Drain on paper towels.
Break into bite-sized pieces when cool.

recipes.pan_size: Microwave roasting rack in glass dish
notes: Also known as 'Millionaire Bacon' or 'Pig Candy'
Can also be baked in oven at 400°F

recipes.title: Easy Pesto Pinwheels
recipes.description: Quick and easy appetizers made with crescent rolls, pesto, and roasted red peppers.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Unroll dough into two long rectangles. Firmly press perforations to smooth.
Spread rectangles with pesto to within ¼-inch of edges; sprinkle with bell peppers.
Starting at shortest side, roll up each rectangle; pinch edges to seal.
Cut each roll into eight slices.
Place, cut side down, on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 13 to 17 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately remove from cookie sheet. Serve warm.

notes: Can substitute sun-dried tomatoes for roasted peppers
Make ahead and refrigerate before baking

recipes.title: Caramel Apple Dip
recipes.description: A creamy caramel dip for apples and fruit made with milk powder and caramel topping.

instructions.text: Place milk powder, sugar, butter, salt, and boiling water in blender. Blend until consistency is even and no sugar remains on sides of blender container.
Add caramel topping and mix until well blended. Store in covered container.
Dip apple slices, marshmallows, pineapple, or bananas, etc. into caramel mixture and eat. Chopped peanuts may be added, or used as a second dip on the side.

recipes.title: Layered Bean Dip
recipes.description: A layered Tex-Mex dip with beans, taco seasoning, sour cream, and melted cheese.

instructions.text: Spread bean dip around bottom and sides of pie plate.
Mix together taco seasoning, sour cream, and mayonnaise; spread over beans.
Spread mashed avocado over that.
Sprinkle with chopped onion and then cheeses.
Sprinkle with tomato and olives.
Heat at 350°F until cheese melts, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve hot from oven with taco or corn chips.

recipes.title: Nacho Dip
recipes.description: A hearty ground beef and Velveeta cheese dip served with nacho chips.

instructions.text: Brown hamburger and onion; drain fat.
Melt cheese; add soup and picante sauce.
Mix. Add meat mixture; mix well.
Serve with plain nacho chips.

notes: You may want to melt cheese in microwave, then transfer to a slow cooker to keep the cheese warm.

recipes.title: Shrimp-Crabmeat Dip
recipes.description: An elegant seafood dip with cream cheese, shrimp, and crabmeat topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Add enough milk or cream to cream cheese for good spreading consistency.
Spread on large round plate.
Spread seafood sauce over cheese.
Top with shrimp and crabmeat.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on and garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve with crackers.

flags.issue: Shrimp, crabmeat, and Parmesan quantities not specified

recipes.title: Pineapple Cheese Ball
recipes.description: A sweet and savory cheese ball with crushed pineapple, rolled in chopped pecans.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Drain pineapple and add along with 1 cup pecans, green pepper, onions, and salt.
Shape into ball and roll in remaining nuts.
Wrap in foil and refrigerate until well chilled.
Serve with assorted crackers.

notes: Also shown: Soften cream cheese; gradually stir in crushed pineapple, 1 cup of pecans, green pepper, onion, and salt. Chill well. Form into ball and roll in 1 cup pecans. Garnish with cherries and parsley.

recipes.title: Shrimp and Cheddar Cheese on English Muffins
recipes.description: Easy appetizer bites with shrimp and cheese spread broiled on English muffins.

instructions.text: Soften cheese.
Mash up shrimp. Mix together; spread over muffins.
Cut into 6 pie shape pieces. (Can freeze at this point!)
Put under broiler (10 minutes if frozen) until golden brown.

notes: Can be frozen before broiling

recipes.title: Stuffed Pumpernickel Surprise
recipes.description: A creamy spinach dip served in a hollowed pumpernickel bread bowl.

ingredients.item: Knorr vegetable soup and recipe mix

instructions.text: Mix soup mix, sour cream, and mayonnaise until well blended.
Stir in spinach, water chestnuts, and onions.
Cover and chill 2 hours.
Cut out top of loaf in a circle.
Arrange on platter or tray. Pull bite-size pieces from center and inside loaf.
Place around loaf. Fill the center of loaf with chilled dip.
Enjoy.

recipes.title: Cheese Ring
recipes.description: A molded cheese appetizer ring coated in pecans, served with crackers.

instructions.text: Combine first 5 ingredients and mix well.
Sprinkle about 1/4 cup pecans in an oiled 7-cup ring mold.
Press cheese mixture into mold. Chill until firm.
Unmold on platter. Pat remaining pecans onto cheese ring.
Garnish with parsley sprigs.
Serve on crackers with strawberry preserves on top if desired.

recipes.title: Holiday Cheese Ball
recipes.description: A festive cheese ball with cream cheese, pineapple, and pecans.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and beat until smooth.
Gradually stir in crushed pineapple, 1 cup of pecans, green pepper, onion, and salt.
Chill well.
Form into ball and roll in remaining 1 cup pecans.
Garnish with cherries and parsley.
Serve with assorted crackers.

flags.issue: Recipe starts on this page but instructions were on previous page (not captured)

recipes.title: Crabbies
recipes.description: Hot crabmeat and cheese appetizers on English muffins.

instructions.text: Mix first 4 ingredients and spread on split muffins.
Place on cookie sheets and broil until bubbly and golden on top.
Cool for a few minutes, then cut into 4 pieces each and serve while hot.

recipes.title: Pigs in a Blanket
recipes.description: Hot dogs wrapped in cheese-topped biscuits - a kid-friendly appetizer.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Flatten all biscuits, not touching sides on ungreased cookie sheets.
Cut slices of cheese into fourths. Lay one piece on each biscuit.
Cut hot dogs in halves. Lay the half into the biscuit and cheese.
Fold sides of biscuits together over hot dog. Hold in place with toothpick.
Cook for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Spinach Dip
recipes.description: Classic spinach dip served in a pumpernickel bread bowl.

instructions.text: Thaw spinach and drain.
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut out center section of bread, then put dip mixture in bread.
Use bread chunks from center and also sliced vegetables with dip.

recipes.title: Taco Dip
recipes.description: A layered taco dip with cream cheese, taco sauce, and fresh toppings.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese. Stir in 3/4 of the jar of taco sauce.
Spread on a platter.
Top with lettuce, onion, cheese, tomatoes, and black olives.
Serve with nacho chips.

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Dip
recipes.description: A layered avocado and bean dip with all the Tex-Mex fixings.

instructions.text: Peel, pit, and mash avocados in medium size bowl with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, and seasoning in a bowl.

Spread bean dip in a large shallow serving platter and top with layers in the following order: Seasoned avocado mixture, sour cream/taco mix, sprinkle with chopped onions, tomatoes, olives, and cheese.
Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Creamy Fruit Dip
recipes.description: A simple two-ingredient dip for fresh fruit.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese in microwave or let cream cheese get to room temperature.
Mix in marshmallow cream. Stir well until well blended.
Serve with fresh fruit.

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs - The Best
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs with bacon and sweet pickles.

instructions.text: Cut eggs lengthwise and remove yolks. Mash yolks with a fork and add remaining ingredients.
Blend well. Refill whites using approximately 2 teaspoons of egg mixture per half.
Hint: Fix the day before to let the seasonings blend.

notes: Make the day before for best flavor

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Greg's Eggs
recipes.description: Spicy deviled eggs with jalapeno and bacon bits.

instructions.text: Hard-boil eggs and cut lengthwise; remove yolks.
Mix yolks with salad dressing, vinegar, sugar, and mustard until creamy.
Stir in shredded pickles and jalapeno pepper.
Add bacon bits and grated cheese; don't overstir. Stuff into egg white halves.

notes: Use real bacon bits - imitation ones get soggy
Adjust jalapeno to taste

recipes.title: Spinach Nuggets (Microwave)
recipes.description: Quick spinach appetizer balls cooked in the microwave.

instructions.text: Place spinach and onion in 1 1/2 quart casserole with water. Cook, covered, on HIGH 9 to 11 minutes, stirring once. Let stand 3 minutes. Drain well.
Add butter and stir till melted. Add stuffing mix and Parmesan cheese. Stir in eggs.
Shape into 1 inch balls. May be frozen. (Put in freezer for 10 minutes after putting on waxed paper lined baking sheet; thaw before cooking.)
To cook now, place 1/2 of balls in a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2 inch baking dish. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes, or until heated through. Repeat with remaining 1/2 of balls.

notes: May be frozen ahead and thawed before cooking

recipes.title: Greek Salsa
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping from ATHENOS product packaging
recipes.description: A Mediterranean-style salsa dip with feta, olives, cucumber, and roasted red peppers. Served with pita chips.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until well blended.
Serve with pita chips.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Greek vinaigrette dressing

recipes.title: 7-Layer Taco Dip
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe card from Bob Evans
recipes.description: A hearty layered taco dip with sausage, beans, sour cream, salsa, and all the fixings. Perfect for game day.

instructions.text: In large skillet over medium heat, crumble and cook sausage until browned.
Stir in beans, chilies and taco seasoning mix.
Spread sausage mix into 7" x 11" serving dish.
Top with sour cream, then salsa.
Sprinkle olives, tomato and onion on top. Cover with cheese.
Serve immediately with chips. Refrigerate leftovers.

missing_inputs: Not in database: taco seasoning mix
assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for refried beans
Used standard can size (0.5 cups) for chopped green chilies
Used standard can size (0.75 cups) for sliced black olives
Used standard jar size (2.0 cups) for salsa

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 158
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese
dippers (cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables)

instructions.text: Bring shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside. Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper. Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables. Makes 5 servings.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
*Note: For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If you don't have a fondue pot, just serve this creamy fondue from a casserole dish.

ingredients.item: dry white wine or apple juice
package cream cheese with chives, softened
Dippers (breadsticks, cubed French bread, fruit wedges, or vegetables)

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan heat wine or juice just till bubbling. Add American cheese and mustard, stirring till smooth and bubbly. Stir in cream cheese; cook and stir over low heat till smooth.
Transfer mixture to a fondue pot. If desired, keep cheese mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with dippers. Serves 3.

Microwave directions: In 1-quart casserole mix ½ cup wine or juice, American cheese, mustard, and cream cheese. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 4 to 5 minutes or till melted and bubbly, stir every minute. Serve as above.

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese (12 ounces)
Dippers (cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables)

instructions.text: Bring shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside. Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper. Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables. Makes 5 servings.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
Note: For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue

recipes.description: Classic Swiss cheese fondue with crusty bread dippers

instructions.text: Bring cheese to room temperature. Toss together Gruyere, Swiss cheese, and flour.
In a saucepan heat wine and garlic over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface.
Remove and discard garlic.
Gradually add small amounts of cheese mixture to wine, stirring constantly with a wire whisk after each addition till cheese is melted. Make sure cheese melts completely before adding more.
Stir till fondue bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch and nutmeg.
Transfer fondue to a fondue pot; keep warm over fondue burner.
Serve with French bread cubes. (If fondue becomes too thick, stir in a little warmed wine.)

notes: Bring cheese to room temperature for best melting
If fondue becomes too thick, stir in a little warmed wine

recipes.title: Crunchy Party Mix
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Odds are, you won't have any of this crispy snack left, but if you do, freeze it for up to four months.

ingredients.item: bite-size wheat or bran square cereal
bite-size rice or corn square cereal or bite-size shredded wheat biscuits

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix margarine, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
In a large roasting pan mix pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle margarine mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat.
Bake in a 300° oven for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes. Spread on foil to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure combine the margarine or butter, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and hot pepper sauce. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1½ to 2 minutes or till margarine melts, stirring once. In a 3-quart casserole combine half of the pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle half of the margarine mixture over cereal mixture, tossing to coat evenly. Cook, uncovered, on high for 5½ to 6 minutes or till hot, stirring three times. Spread on foil to cool (mix will become crisp on standing). Repeat with remaining ingredients.

Oriental-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except omit Worcestershire sauce and pretzels. Add 3 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 teaspoons five-spice powder to margarine mixture. Add one 5-ounce can chow mein noodles and 2 cups bite-size fish-shape crackers to cereal.

Italian-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except omit hot pepper sauce and increase garlic powder to 1 teaspoon. Add 2 teaspoons dried Italian seasoning to the margarine mixture. Immediately after baking, toss the warm cereal mixture with ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese.
Cajun-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except increase hot pepper sauce to 1 tablespoon and substitute 3 cups pecan halves for nuts.

instructions.text: Prick potatoes with a fork. Bake in a 425° oven for 40 to 50 minutes or till tender. Cut into quarters. Scoop out the insides (reserve for another use), leaving ½-inch-thick shells.
Brush both sides of potato skins with margarine. Place, cut side up, on a large baking sheet.
Bake in a 425° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till crisp. Sprinkle with cheese and, if desired, salt. Bake about 2 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serve with salsa and green onion.

notes: Fried Potato Skins: Prepare as above, except omit margarine and do not bake a second time. In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches melted shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry shells, a few at a time, for 1 to 2 minutes or till golden. recipes.description: These delectable morsels hold plenty of cheddar or blue cheese.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or crumbled blue cheese

instructions.text: Wash and drain mushrooms. Remove stems. Reserve caps. Chop enough stems to make 1 cup.
In a medium saucepan cook stems, onion, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender.
Stir in bread crumbs and cheese. Spoon crumb mixture into mushroom caps.
Arrange mushrooms in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 425° oven 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through.

notes: Spinach-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit cheese. Cook 1 cup chopped fresh spinach with the stem mixture. Stir ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese and ½ teaspoon crushed dried marjoram into crumb mixture.

Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit margarine or butter and cheese. Reduce bread crumbs to 2 tablespoons. Cook ½ pound bulk Italian sausage with stem mixture till sausage is brown. Drain fat. Stir 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs into sausage mixture.
Pepperoni-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit cheese. Stir ¼ cup chopped pepperoni and ½ teaspoon dried Italian seasoning into the crumb mixture.

Creamy Blue Cheese Dip: Prepare as above, except omit dillweed and seasoned salt. Stir ½ cup crumbled blue cheese and ½ cup finely chopped walnuts into the beaten cream cheese mixture.
Creamy Seafood Dip: Prepare as above, except stir one 6½-ounce can minced clams, drained, or crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed, into beaten cheese mixture.

recipes.title: Cheese and Pesto Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and Brie cheese.

For pesto, in a blender container combine basil, parsley, Parmesan cheese, nuts, garlic, and 2 tablespoons oil. Cover; blend with on-off turns till a paste forms. Gradually add remaining oil, blending on low speed till smooth.
Beat cream cheese and Brie together till nearly smooth. Beat whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture.
Line a 3½- or 4-cup mold with plastic wrap. Spread one-fourth of cheese mixture into mold. Top with one-third of pesto. Repeat layers twice. Top with cheese mixture. Chill 6 to 24 hours.
To serve, unmold on plate. Remove plastic wrap. Garnish with fresh basil, if desired. Serve with crackers.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, parsley, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add beef. Mix well.

In a saucepan combine juice mixture, 2 tablespoons catsup, 2 tablespoons vinegar, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ½ teaspoon instant beef bouillon granules, and dash ground red pepper. recipes.title: Cheese Twists

Swiss-Caraway Twists: Prepare as above, except substitute Swiss cheese for the cheddar or American cheese and caraway seed for the sesame seed or poppy seed.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 1 stick piecrust mix, ½ cup shredded cheddar cheese, and a dash ground red pepper. Prepare piecrust dough according to package directions.
Pat 30 pitted ripe or pimiento-stuffed olives dry with paper towels. Shape about 1 teaspoon of the dough around each olive. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for shredded cheddar cheese (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for ground red pepper (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Egg Rolls
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: These crisp, golden egg rolls make a delicious start to any meal.

ingredients.item: Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling

instructions.text: For each egg roll, place one egg roll skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon about ¼ cup of the desired filling just below the center of egg roll skin.
Fold the corner nearest you over the filling, tucking the corner under the filling. Fold side corners over top, like an envelope. Roll up toward the remaining corner.
Moisten the point with water and press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 365°. Fry the egg rolls, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm egg rolls with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce

recipes.title: Wontons
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Every bit as tasty as egg rolls, wontons are smaller and more manageable at appetizer parties. One or two bites and it's time to reach for another.

ingredients.item: Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling

instructions.text: For each wonton, place one wonton skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon a rounded teaspoon of desired filling just below the center of wonton skin.

Fold the corner closest to you over the filling and tuck it under the filling. Roll up, leaving 1 inch unrolled at the top. Moisten the right corner with water. Grasp right and left corners and bring them over the filling, lapping the right corner over the left corner. Press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 365°. Fry the wontons, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce

recipes.title: Crab Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Use this or any of the following three fillings for either Egg Rolls or Wontons.
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a skillet cook 1 cup chopped Chinese cabbage or cabbage, ½ cup finely chopped pea pods, ¼ cup chopped water chestnuts, 2 tablespoons finely chopped onion, and 1 clove garlic, minced, in 1 tablespoon cooking oil for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove from heat.

In a mixing bowl combine one 6-ounce can crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed; 2 tablespoons soy sauce; 2 tablespoons dry sherry; ⅛ teaspoon pepper; and the cooked vegetable mixture. Toss to mix.

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely chopped pea pods
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for chopped water chestnuts

recipes.title: Pork and Shrimp Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: Thaw one 6-ounce package frozen, peeled, cooked shrimp. Cut up shrimp.

In a mixing bowl combine shrimp, ½ cup finely chopped cooked pork, ½ cup finely chopped bean sprouts, ½ cup finely chopped fresh mushrooms, ¼ cup sliced green onion, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot. Mix well.

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely chopped bean sprouts
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped cooked pork (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped fresh mushrooms (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for sliced green onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Ham-Orange Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a bowl combine ¾ cup finely chopped fully cooked ham, ½ cup chopped bamboo shoots, ½ cup finely chopped onion, ½ cup finely chopped broccoli, ½ teaspoon finely shredded orange peel, 2 tablespoons orange juice, and ⅛ teaspoon ground red pepper. Mix well.

assumptions: Inferred 0.5 for finely chopped fully cooked ham (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for chopped bamboo shoots
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for finely chopped broccoli
Assumed 1 unit for finely shredded orange peel

recipes.title: Vegetable Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a steamer basket over boiling water place 1 cup chopped fresh spinach, 1 cup shredded carrot, 1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms, ½ cup shredded zucchini, and ¼ cup finely chopped onion. Cover; steam for 4 minutes. Drain well.
Transfer to a mixing bowl. Stir in 2 tablespoons soy sauce, ½ teaspoon dry mustard, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and ⅛ teaspoon garlic powder.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Spinach Phyllo Triangles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For filling, cook spinach, onion, and garlic according to spinach package directions. Drain well in colander. Press the back of a spoon against mixture to force out excess moisture. Combine spinach mixture, feta cheese, and oregano.

Lightly brush 1 sheet of phyllo with some of the melted margarine or butter. Place another phyllo sheet on top; brush with some margarine. Repeat with a third sheet of phyllo and margarine. (Cover the remaining phyllo with a damp cloth to prevent drying.) Cut the stack of phyllo lengthwise into 6 strips.

For each triangle, spoon about 1 tablespoon of the filling about 1 inch from one end of each strip. Fold the end over the filling at a 45-degree angle. Continue folding to form a triangle that encloses filling. Repeat with remaining phyllo, margarine or butter, and filling.
Place triangles on a baking sheet. Brush with margarine. Bake in a 375° oven for 18 to 20 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

missing_inputs: Not in database: sheets phyllo dough
assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Oysters Rockefeller
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook spinach and onion in a small amount of boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes or till tender. Drain; press out excess moisture.
Thoroughly wash oysters. Open shells with an oyster knife or other blunt-tipped knife. Remove oysters and dry. Discard flat top shells; wash deep bottom shells. Place each oyster in a shell.
Combine spinach mixture, 2 tablespoons of margarine, parsley, garlic, hot sauce, and dash pepper. Spoon 1 teaspoon atop each oyster.
Toss together crumbs and remaining margarine. Sprinkle over spinach-topped oysters.
Line a shallow baking pan with rock salt to about ½-inch depth. (Or, use crumpled foil to keep shells from tipping.) Arrange oysters atop.
Bake in a 425° oven 10 to 12 minutes or till edges of oysters begin to curl.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for fine dry seasoned bread crumbs

recipes.title: Salmon Mousse
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Drain salmon, reserving liquid. Add water to liquid to make ½ cup. In saucepan sprinkle gelatin over reserved liquid. Let stand 5 minutes. Heat and stir till gelatin dissolves. Remove from heat.
Mix mayonnaise, chili sauce, and lemon juice. Stir into gelatin. Chill till partially set (consistency of unbeaten egg whites). Fold in salmon, eggs, celery, onion, chives, and ⅛ teaspoon pepper.
Beat cream till soft peaks form. Fold into gelatin mixture. Pour into a 3½- or 4-cup mold. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
Unmold on lettuce-lined serving platter. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for mayonnaise or salad dressing
Inferred 0.5 for finely chopped celery (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Shrimp Cocktail
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Arrange shrimp in six lettuce-lined cocktail cups or glasses.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the Cocktail Sauce over each. Serve with lemon.

notes: Fruit Shrimp Cocktail: Prepare as above, except toss 1 peeled and sectioned orange, 1 peeled and sectioned grapefruit, and 1 seeded, peeled, and sliced avocado with the shrimp.
Crab Cocktail: Prepare as above, except substitute two 6-ounce packages frozen crabmeat, thawed, and 2 cups finely chopped celery for the shrimp.

recipes.title: Codfish Balls
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Soak cod in water to cover for 4 to 24 hours; change water often. Drain; cut into small pieces.
Cook cod, potatoes, and onion in boiling water about 10 minutes or till tender; drain. Beat mixture till combined.
Beat in egg, cheese, parsley, margarine, and ¼ teaspoon pepper.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 375°. Drop cod mixture by heaping tablespoons, a few at a time, into hot fat. Fry about 2 minutes or till golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar or cocktail sauce, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Batter-Fried Vegetables
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Bottled buttermilk salad dressing or sweet-and-sour sauce also make flavorful dipping sauces.

ingredients.item: ice water, cold milk, or cold beer

vegetables (fresh whole mushrooms; cauliflower or broccoli flowerets; green pepper strips; onion rings; green onions; fresh green beans; fresh asparagus, cut into 2-inch lengths; sweet potato, peeled and cut into ¼-inch-thick slices; eggplant, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes)

instructions.text: For batter, in a medium mixing bowl stir together egg and ice water, milk, or beer. Add flour all at once. Beat with a rotary beater or wire whisk till mixture is smooth. Set aside.
Rinse vegetables under cold water; drain. Pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°. Dip vegetables, a few at a time, into the batter, swirling to coat. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till light golden brown. Drain vegetables on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven. Repeat with remaining vegetables. Serve with individual bowls of Dipping Sauce.

notes: Dipping Sauce: In a small saucepan stir together 1 cup water, ¼ cup dry sherry, ¼ cup soy sauce, and 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot. Bring just to boiling. Remove from heat; keep warm. Makes 1⅓ cups.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Fried Cheese
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Seasoned crumbs keep the melted cheese inside.

instructions.text: Cut the cheese into 2½x½x½-inch sticks. Combine crumbs and fines herbes.

Dip cheese sticks into eggs, then roll in crumb mixture, coating evenly. Dip cheese into egg and crumbs again. (Be sure cheese is completely coated with crumbs.) Chill 2 to 4 hours to set the coating.
In a heavy saucepan or a deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°. Fry the cheese sticks, a few at a time, for 30 to 45 seconds or till golden. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with taco sauce, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The refreshing herb-cheese filling brings out the best in these tiny tomatoes.

ingredients.item: snipped fresh or frozen chives, or 1 teaspoon dried chives

instructions.text: Slice a thin layer off top of each tomato. Using a small spoon, carefully scoop out and discard pulp. Invert tomatoes; drain on paper towels.
For filling, in a small bowl combine cream cheese, chives, milk, basil, pepper, and garlic powder. Beat till smooth.
Spoon or pipe the filling into tomatoes. Serve immediately or chill up to 8 hours.

recipes.title: Chicken Liver Pâté
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ground nutmeg or ⅛ teaspoon ground allspice

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons of drippings. Drain and crumble bacon; set aside.
Add chicken livers, onion, and garlic to reserved drippings. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes or till livers are no longer pink. Cool slightly.

In a blender container or food processor bowl place 2 tablespoons milk, salt, nutmeg or allspice, pepper, chicken liver mixture, and bacon. Cover and blend or process till well combined. (Add 1 tablespoon milk if mixture appears stiff.)
Line a 1½-cup mold or small bowl with plastic wrap. Spoon mixture into mold. Cover; chill 3 to 24 hours.
To serve, unmold and remove wrap. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for ground nutmeg or ⅛ teaspoon ground allspice

recipes.title: Marinated Cheese and Olives
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The cheese takes on a trio of Mediterranean flavors: lemon, garlic, and fennel.

ingredients.item: cheddar, Colby, Edam, Gouda, or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Cut cheese and pepperoni or salami into ½-inch pieces.
In a bowl combine oil, lemon juice, garlic, fennel seed, and pepper.
Stir in cheese, pepperoni or salami, and olives. Cover and chill up to 3 days, stirring occasionally.
Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Serve with toothpicks.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for olive oil or salad oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Lemon and Herb Mushrooms
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Oregano and thyme add zest to these tangy mouthfuls.

instructions.text: Halve any large mushrooms. In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms in boiling water 1 minute. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
For marinade, in a small saucepan combine lemon juice, salad oil, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and thyme. Cook till boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
In a medium mixing bowl combine drained mushrooms, hot marinade, and sliced onion. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole micro-cook mushrooms and 2 tablespoons water, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 4 minutes or till tender. Drain and set aside. In the same casserole combine lemon juice, salad oil, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and thyme. Cook, uncovered, on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till boiling. Assemble as above.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for small fresh whole mushrooms (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for coarse ground black pepper (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Melon and Prosciutto
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spicy prosciutto, a thinly sliced Italian ham, meshes perfectly with cool crisp melon.

ingredients.item: large cantaloupe or honeydew melon, or half of each melon
very thinly sliced prosciutto or fully cooked ham

instructions.text: Cut cantaloupe or honeydew melon in half and remove seeds. Use a melon baller to scoop out pulp, or cut pulp into bite-size cubes.
Cut prosciutto or ham into 1-inch-wide strips.
Wrap one strip of prosciutto or ham around each melon ball. Fasten with a toothpick.

recipes.title: Easy Guacamole
recipes.description: Simple and delicious guacamole.

instructions.text: Place avocados in bowl and sprinkle with lime juice, salt, and pepper; mash with fork until desired texture.
Stir remaining ingredients into avocados. Chill 30 minutes for flavors to blend or until ready to serve.

notes: Other preparation methods: Bake - Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut 1 ripe, peeled avocado into 8 wedges; place in baking dish. Coat with 1 tablespoon each: salt, oil and 1/4 teaspoon each: salt, pepper, and red pepper. Bake 20-25 minutes or until edges are golden. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon fresh lime juice. Sauce: Place 2 ripe, peeled avocados into food processor bowl; add 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 1 1/2 cups fresh cilantro, 1/4 cup sour cream, and 1/2 teaspoon total seasoning. Process until smooth. Serve over chicken, beef, or pork.

recipes.title: Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: Large mushroom caps stuffed with seasoned pork sausage.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, place sausage.
Remove stems from mushrooms. Finely chop stems. Mix with sausage. Place mushroom caps on baking pan with top-sides down.
Divide sausage mixture into 16 portions. Shape into balls. Place one ball into each mushroom cap.
Sprinkle tops lightly with salt and pepper.
Bake at 400°F for 15 to 20 minutes until sausage is browned and cooked through.
Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with: Herbed rice pilaf and a tossed salad to make a light supper.
Tips: To clean mushrooms, gently rinse in cold water and pat dry.
Variations: You may substitute bulk Italian or Polish sausage for the breakfast-style sausage. For variety, serve mushrooms on buttered toast or tomato slices.

recipes.title: Pizza Horns

instructions.text: To thaw dough, refrigerate overnight or let stand at room temperature for 2 to 3 hours.
On a lightly floured surface, roll each loaf into a 10-inch circle or pat and stretch with hands until 1/4-inch thick. Brush surface with oil.
With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut each circle into 8 triangular wedges.
Combine sauce, oregano and garlic powder. Spread on top of wedges, leaving about 1/4-inch margin on each side.
Sprinkle with cheeses, green pepper and pepperoni. Roll up, each triangle beginning from wide end. Curve ends to form crescents.
Place on lightly oiled baking sheets. Brush tops with egg white. Sprinkle with additional oregano and/or Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 450°F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Health Note: Using frozen wheat bread dough adds extra nutrition to this recipe. Tips: You may vary the filling according to taste. Try toppings such as mushrooms or onions.

assumptions: frozen bread dough: used default unit
pizza oregano leaves: used default unit
lightly beaten oregano: used default unit

recipes.title: Garlic Bean Dip
recipes.description: Creamy white bean dip with garlic and cumin.

ingredients.item: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise or Dressing

instructions.text: In food processor combine first 5 ingredients. Process 1 minute, scraping bowl once, or until almost smooth.
Blend in mayonnaise and parsley.
Serve with Pita Crisps (see recipe on next page), melba toasts or cut-up vegetables.

assumptions: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise or Dressing: used default unit

recipes.title: Daisy Potato Skins

instructions.text: Lightly grease outside of potatoes. Cut a small slit in top and bake at 425°F for 45 minutes. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out cooked potato, leaving a very thin layer of potato interior. (Save cooked potato for mashed potatoes or hash browns.) Brush outside and inside of skins with melted butter. Sprinkle inside with steak seasoning and Parmesan cheese melted. Place on bubbly greased baking sheet. Bake 8 minutes or until crisp and bubbly.

Let stand until cool enough to handle, and scoop out cooked potato, leaving a thin layer. Brush outside and inside of skins with butter. Bake 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top each with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with chives.

notes: Save cooked potato for mashed potatoes or hash browns.
Brush inside and outside of skins with steak seasoning and Parmesan.

recipes.title: Warm and Creamy Bacon Dip

instructions.text: Bring cream cheese to room temperature. Preheat oven to 400°F. In a bowl, combine all ingredients. Place in 1-quart baking dish. Cover.
Heat 25-30 minutes or until hot. Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips. Makes 3 cups.

notes: Serving option: Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.
Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.
Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips.

recipes.title: Bhel Puri
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Chaat Feature
recipes.description: Look for puffed rice and sev at Indian markets; you can substitute chow mein noodles for sev. Find chutneys on the supermarket's international aisle.

instructions.text: Place potato in a medium saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil; cook 8 minutes or until tender. Drain; cool.
Combine potato and remaining ingredients in a large bowl; toss well. Serve immediately. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: about 1 cup).

notes: CALORIES 163; FAT 1.3g (sat 0.2g, mono 0.3g, poly 0.1g); PROTEIN 3.9g; CARB 34g; FIBER 2g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 10mg; SODIUM 210mg; CALC 22mg

recipes.title: Pepper Pancakes with Fresh Cilantro Chutney
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Chaat Feature
recipes.servings_yield: 6 servings (serving size: 1 pancake, about 2 teaspoons chutney, and 1 tablespoon yogurt)
recipes.description: Indian street food—a variety of small snack plates—often defined by a balance of spicy and acidic, salty and sweet, and soft salt and crunchy components. The idea of small plates featuring the vibrant tastes of northern and western India is starting to take hold in this country.

instructions.text: Place first 7 ingredients in a food processor; pulse 4 times or until chopped.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add bell pepper and 1/4 cup onion; cook 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add serrano; cook 1 minute. Place bell pepper mixture in a large bowl. Weigh or lightly spoon flours into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Add flours, salt, cumin, and fennel seeds to bell pepper mixture. Stir in 1 cup water, and let stand 3 minutes.

Heat 1/4 teaspoon oil in pan over medium heat. Pour 1/3 cup batter per pancake into pan; spread batter into 2 (5-inch) circles. Cook 2 minutes or until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked. Flip pancakes; cook 2 minutes or until bottoms are lightly browned. Repeat procedure twice with remaining oil and batter. Serve with chutney and yogurt. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: 1 pancake, about 2 teaspoons chutney, and 1 tablespoon yogurt).

notes: CALORIES 134; FAT 3.1g (sat 0.2g, mono 1.2g, poly 0.6g); PROTEIN 4.8g; CARB 17.5g; FIBER 1.7g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 1.3mg; SODIUM 309mg; CALC 49mg

recipes.title: Lemony Hummus with Spicy Whole-Wheat Pita Chips
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Lunch Feature
recipes.servings_yield: 8 servings (serving size: 3 1/2 tablespoons hummus and 6 chips)
recipes.description: This dish makes a wholesome accompaniment for sandwiches and salads. Keep extra pita chips stored in an airtight container for up to three days.

ingredients.item: can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained
mini whole-wheat pitas, split in half horizontally

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°.
To prepare hummus, combine first 8 ingredients in a food processor; process until smooth.

To prepare chips, combine 2 teaspoons cumin and next 3 ingredients (through red pepper). Cut each pita half into 4 wedges. Arrange pita wedges on a baking sheet. Lightly coat pita with cooking spray. Sprinkle cumin mixture evenly over pita. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until crisp. Serve with hummus. Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 3 1/2 tablespoons hummus and 6 chips).

notes: CALORIES 132; FAT 4g (sat 0.5g, mono 1.8g, poly 1.3g); PROTEIN 4.9g; CARB 20.9g; FIBER 3.4g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 1.5mg; SODIUM 345mg; CALC 38mg

instructions.text: Combine sauces in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring until smooth. Add meatballs. Cover and cook for 15 minutes or until meatballs are heated through, stirring occasionally.
Combine the robust taste of Heinz Chili Sauce and the tangy taste of Ocean Spray Jellied Cranberry Sauce for a uniquely satisfying flavor guaranteed to be a hit!
Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine chili sauce and cranberry sauce in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat, whisking occasionally, until smooth. Reserve one-third of sauce mixture.

Arrange drummettes on baking sheet coated with non-stick spray. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn drummettes over. Brush with remaining sauce mixture until well coated. Bake for additional 20 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with reserved sauce for dipping. Makes 24 appetizers.

recipes.title: Greek Layered Dip with Pita Chips

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°. Line 1 or 2 baking sheets with foil. Cut the pita rounds into eighths. Split each piece in two and place on the prepared baking sheet(s), with the inside of the bread facing up. Spray with the olive oil cooking spray and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of the Greek seasoning. Bake 7 to 10 minutes, or until golden.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, brown the ground lamb with the garlic salt and the remaining 2 teaspoons Greek seasoning. Drain and set aside.

In a shallow 1½-quart dish, spread the hummus on the bottom. Top with a layer of ground lamb, then the tzatziki. Layer with the lettuce, tomatoes, onion, olives and feta. Serve the dip at room temperature with pita chips.

recipes.title: Salmon Sushi Bites
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010 - Sandra Lee Recipe

instructions.text: In a small saucepan over high heat, bring the rice and 1½ cups water to a boil. Reduce the heat; cover and simmer 5 minutes, or until all of the water is absorbed. Stir in the vinegar, sugar, all-purpose seasoning and salt.

On a cutting board, separate the salmon slices and cut into 1½-inch-wide strips. Place 2 teaspoons of the rice at one end of each salmon strip and roll up tightly. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired. Serve the sushi bites with the soy sauce for dipping.
Prepare the pie dough according to the package directions for a double-crust pie. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill.

Preheat the oven to 400°. In a medium saucepan, combine the chicken, salsa and olives. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese. Cool slightly.

On a flour-dusted surface, roll out the dough to ¼ inch thick. Using a 3-inch-round cutter, cut out 36 circles, rerolling the scraps as needed. Place about 1 tablespoon chicken mixture in the center of each circle. Moisten the edges with water. Fold the circles in half and pinch to seal. Pierce the tops with a fork.
Place the empanadas on a baking sheet and bake 15 minutes, or until golden. Serve hot.
Preheat the oven to 400°. Lightly brush 1 side of each baguette slice with olive oil. Place the slices on a baking sheet and toast 5 to 7 minutes, or just until beginning to brown. Let cool.

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and gorgonzola cheese, stirring until well mixed. Spread the toasts with the cheese mixture. Top with the pear slices and chopped candied pecans. Sprinkle with the parsley.
Coarsely grind the fennel seeds, peppercorns and coriander seeds in a spice grinder or with a mortar and pestle. Transfer to a bowl and mix with the salt, sugar and grapefruit zest and juice.

Place the salmon fillets side by side, skin-side down, on a large piece of plastic wrap. Scatter the salt mixture over and around the fish. Top one fillet with the dill, then put the other fillet on top, skin-side up. Pat any extra salt mixture all over the fish. Wrap tightly in the plastic wrap and put the fish on a plate. Cover with another plate and put 2 or 3 heavy cans on top to weigh it down. Refrigerate 2 to 3 days, flipping the salmon daily.
Unwrap the salmon and rinse under cold water to remove the spices and herbs. Pat dry with paper towels. Slice the salmon at an angle as thinly as possible with a sharp knife.

Before serving, press the egg whites through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl. Repeat with the yolks. Arrange the salmon and bread on a platter. Put the chopped onion, chives, capers, beet horseradish and radishes in separate bowls for toppings.
Put 12 halved baby red potatoes in a saucepan and cover with salted water. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook until fork-tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain, then rinse under cold water.
Trim the bottoms of the potatoes and stand cut-side up on a platter; season with sea salt. Top with crème fraîche and chopped chives, dill and/or parsley.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from appetizers category

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs

ingredients.item: fresh pickled cucumber slices, for serving

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, season with salt and cook until golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes; set aside.

Combine ½ cup breadcrumbs and the milk in a bowl; set aside until the milk is absorbed, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir the sherry and mustard powder in a large bowl until dissolved, then beat in 1 egg. Add the soaked breadcrumbs, the browned onion, the pork, turkey, honey, allspice, 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper to taste. Gently mix with your hands until combined.

Dampen your hands; form the mixture into 36 small meatballs, about 1 tablespoon each. Put on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.

Put the remaining 1 cup breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Whisk the remaining 2 eggs and 2 tablespoons water in a bowl. Dip each meatball in egg, letting the excess drip off, then roll in the breadcrumbs; return to the baking sheet.

Heat about 1½ inches vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 325°. Working in batches, fry the meatballs, gently stirring with a slotted spoon, until golden and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and season with salt. Let stand 10 minutes.
Fold the lingonberry preserves into the sour cream and top with the dill. Skewer each meatball with a pickled cucumber slice and serve with the lingonberry cream.

notes: After you shape and bread the meatballs, you can freeze them for up to 2 weeks. To cook, fry for 5 to 6 minutes (do not thaw).
Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Let stand 10 minutes after frying.

missing_inputs: 3 tbsp lingonberry preserves or cranberry preserves

instructions.text: Bring cream cheese to room temperature. Preheat oven to 400°F. In a bowl, combine all ingredients. Place in 1-quart baking dish. Cover. Heat 25-30 minutes or until hot. Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips. Makes 3 cups.
Serving option: Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.

Mix 3 tablespoons melted butter with a pinch of salt and cayenne. Lay out rounds of refrigerated biscuit dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Brush with the butter; top with shredded cheddar and chopped chives. Fold into half-moons and crimp to seal, then bake as the label directs. Brush with more butter.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from appetizers category

ingredients.item: sour cream, plus more for serving
frozen artichoke hearts, thawed, squeezed dry and roughly chopped
tortilla chips and salsa, for serving

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Stir in the spinach and cook until bright green, about 30 seconds. Drain and rinse under cold water; squeeze out the excess moisture, then finely chop.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic and ½ teaspoon salt and cook until the onion is soft, about 2 minutes. Add the flour and cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, parmesan and sour cream.
Return the pot to medium heat. Add the spinach, cheddar and artichokes and stir until the cheese melts and the dip is heated through. Serve warm with tortilla chips, salsa and sour cream.

recipes.title: Pepperoni Roll-Ups
recipes.description: Easy pizza-style appetizers with crescent rolls, pepperoni, and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F.
Unroll the crescent rolls and separate them into 8 triangles.
Place 5 pepperonis and one string cheese half on the large end of the crescent roll.
Roll up the crescent rolls and sprinkle each of them with garlic powder.
Place the rolls on a greased baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve with warm marinara sauce.

notes: Serve with warm marinara sauce.

recipes.title: Asian Meatballs
recipes.description: Baked meatballs with hoisin glaze and sesame seeds.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F.
Grease a large baking sheet.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, sesame oil, Panko crumbs, 1/2 tsp ground ginger, 2 eggs, 3 tsp minced garlic, and green onions.
Shape this mixture into 1-2 inch balls, the size depending on your preference.
Place the balls on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes or until no longer pink on the inside.
While the meatballs are baking, mix together the hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and ground ginger.
When the meatballs are finished baking, dip each one in the sauce and place on a serving dish.
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the meatballs.

recipes.title: Labneh (Lebanese Cream Cheese)
recipes.description: Traditional Lebanese strained yogurt cheese, simple to make with just yogurt, salt, and olive oil.

instructions.text: To make this recipe we will first need two things: some cheesecloth for lining a container (preferably a bowl) and a container. So grab these two things.
Now get your yogurt and put it into the cheesecloth lined dish. Also put in your salt with the yogurt.
Now grab a colander and put it in the sink or into the dish to catch anything that drains off from the mixture.
Allow everything to drain for at least twenty four hours ideally. What is left over from draining is our cheese.
Take the remaining contents and put them in another dish suitable for storage.
Combine with the cheese, some olive oil, making sure to mix it in well.
Make sure to put a lid on this container and keep it in the fridge.
Enjoy.

notes: Allow everything to drain for at least twenty four hours ideally.
Make sure to put a lid on this container and keep it in the fridge.

recipes.title: Muhammara
recipes.description: A Lebanese walnut and pomegranate dip with warm spices - perfect with pita.

instructions.text: Add all ingredients to food processor and blend until smooth.
Serve with pita pieces.

recipes.title: Avocado Salsa
recipes.description: This avocado salsa is smooth, cool and downright refreshing. Scoop it with chips, spoon it over chicken or steak

ingredients.item: 2 cans (2-1/4 ounces each) sliced ripe olives, drained

instructions.text: Combine the corn, olives, red pepper and onion. In another bowl, mix the next seven ingredients, then pour the combination over the corn mixture, tossing to coat. Refrigerate, covered, overnight.
Just before serving, chop avocados and stir gently into the salsa. Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: California Roll
recipes.description: Making your own California sushi roll is surprisingly easy. You'll need a bamboo mat, sushi rice and nori sheets to get started, and with a bit of practice, you'll be a pro in no time.

ingredients.item: 2 cups sushi rice, rinsed and drained
1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and julienned
Optional: Reduced-sodium soy sauce, prepared wasabi and pickled ginger slices

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, combine the rice and water, and let it stand for 30 minutes. This gives the rice enough time to absorb water and cook more uniformly. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low; cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Remove from the heat, and let the rice stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Editor's Tip: Before beginning this step, be sure to wash your rice thoroughly.
Meanwhile, in small bowl, combine the vinegar, sugar and salt, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. You'll use this mixture to season the rice.

Transfer the rice to a large shallow bowl, and drizzle with the vinegar mixture. With a wooden paddle or spoon, stir the rice with a slicing motion to cool it slightly. Cover the rice with a damp cloth to keep it from drying out. Editor's Tip: This rice mixture may be made up to two hours ahead and stored at room temperature, covered with a damp towel. Do not refrigerate or it will ruin the texture of the sushi rice.

Sprinkle toasted and black sesame seeds onto a plate, and set it aside. Place your sushi mat on a work surface so the mat rolls away from you; line the mat with plastic wrap. Place 3/4 cup rice on plastic. With moistened fingers, press the rice into an 8-inch square. It's OK to see a few tiny holes in the square. The rice will get pressed together when you roll. Top the rice square with one nori sheet. Editor's Tip: The nori has a smooth side and a rough side, which you can feel if you drag a finger across the sheet. Lay the nori on the rice with the rough side facing you and the smooth side pressed into the rice.

Arrange a small amount of cucumber, crab and avocado about 1-1/2 inches from bottom edge of the nori sheet. (Less is more here. You don't want to overstuff the roll or it won't roll into perfect pinwheels in the end.) Using your bamboo mat, roll up the rice mixture over the filling. The mat can lift and compress the mixture while rolling, bringing one side of the rice square to the other and pinching it closed along the seam. Remove the plastic wrap as you roll. You'll keep this sheet over the sushi so it doesn't dry out while you make more rolls.

Remove the mat from your work station, and roll the sushi roll in the sesame seeds. Cover with the plastic wrap. Repeat these steps with the remaining ingredients to make eight rolls. Cut each roll into eight pieces. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi and ginger slices if desired.

recipes.title: Cashew Cheese
recipes.description: There are few food situations this vegan cashew cheese can't elevate. It's easy to make and ready to be spread on crackers or transformed into mac and cheese.

instructions.text: Place the cashews in a small bowl and add enough warm water to cover them completely. Soak the cashews for one to two hours; drain and discard the water. Editor's Tip: You can soak your cashews for as long as overnight.

Add the cashews and the remaining five ingredients to your food processor. Cover and process until smooth, one to two minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally. Transfer the cheese to a serving dish. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Editor's Tip: You can also make this in a blender, although we find it more effective in a food processor due to the amount of liquid used.

recipes.title: Garlic Bean Dip
recipes.description: There isn't a bean that my family does not like. In fact, I serve one kind or another almost every day. This dip is one of our favorite ways to eat them.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
Baked pita chips or assorted fresh vegetables

instructions.text: Place first 5 ingredients in a food processor; process until almost smooth. Add mayonnaise and parsley; pulse just until blended. Serve with pita chips or vegetables.

recipes.title: Orange Shrimp Mojo
recipes.description: With jalapeno, orange and avocado, this enticing entree is spicy, tangy and fresh with every bite. The sauce beautifully glazes the shrimp.
